com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer

Class SingleConsumerCircularBuffer<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer.SingleConsumerCircularBuffer<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - The type of element in the buffer.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CircularBuffer<E>, CircularBufferMXBean

    public final class SingleConsumerCircularBuffer<E>
extends Object
implements CircularBuffer<E>
    Implementation of CircularBuffer suitable when there is only a single consumer thread.

    This implementation handles both the single and multiple producer cases, however, by default is tuned for the multiple producer case. This aspect of the implementation could be factored out in future to further optimize the single producer single consumer case.

    This implementation guarantees the circular buffer capacity is a power of 2 for optimized wrapping index calculations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SingleConsumerCircularBuffer

        public SingleConsumerCircularBuffer(int minimumCapacity,
                                    ElementFactory<E> elementFactory)
        Constructor.

        Parameters:
        minimumCapacity - The minimum buffer capacity. The actual capacity will be this number rounded up to the next power of 2.
        elementFactory - The buffer element factory. The buffer is pre-initialized with elements obtained via this factory. May not be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the elementFactory parameter is null.

      • SingleConsumerCircularBuffer

        public SingleConsumerCircularBuffer(int minimumCapacity,
                                    ElementFactory<E> elementFactory,
                                    Barrier producerEntryBarrier,
                                    Barrier producerCommitBarrier,
                                    Barrier consumerBarrier)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        minimumCapacity - The minimum buffer capacity. The actual capacity will be this number rounded up to the next power of 2.
        elementFactory - The buffer element factory. The buffer is pre-initialized with elements obtained via this factory. May not be null.
        producerEntryBarrier - Barrier used by producers to wait for the next entry in the buffer to become available (i.e. for the consumer to catch up). This barrier protects against producer overrun (i.e. the producer wrapping around onto elements that are not yet consumed). May not be null.
        producerCommitBarrier - Barrier used by producers to sequence the commit ordering. May not be null.
        consumerBarrier - Barrier used by the consumer to wait for the producers to producer new entries. May not be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any parameters are null.

    • Method Detail

      • shutdownProducers

        public void shutdownProducers()
        Description copied from interface: CircularBuffer
        Shutdown the producing side of the buffer.

        This method is used to permanently shutdown the buffer for production. Any producer threads that are currently blocked are awoken forced to handle java.lang.InterruptedException. If producing threads continue to attempt to produce following this the behaviour is undefined.

        Specified by:
        shutdownProducers in interface CircularBuffer<E>

      • shutdownConsumers

        public void shutdownConsumers()
        Description copied from interface: CircularBuffer
        Shutdown the consuming side of the buffer.

        This method is used to permanently shutdown the buffer for consumption. Any consumer threads that are currently blocked are awoken forced to handle java.lang.InterruptedException. If consuming threads continue to attempt to consume following this the behaviour is undefined.

        Specified by:
        shutdownConsumers in interface CircularBuffer<E>
